title: Aundha Nagnath Temple
subtitle: The First Jyotirlinga of Lord Shiva in Maharashtra
overview: Aundha Nagnath Temple, located in Hingoli district, is revered as the first of the twelve Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva. This ancient temple holds immense significance among Shaivites and is believed to have been built by the Yadava dynasty in the 13th century.

The temple’s grand stone structure and spiritual atmosphere attract thousands of devotees annually, especially during the holy month of Shravan. The Shivalinga here is said to have been worshipped by the Pandavas during their exile.

highlights.title: Jyotirlinga Shrine
highlights.description: Recognized as the first Jyotirlinga of Lord Shiva, representing immense spiritual power.

highlights.title: Yadava-Era Architecture
highlights.description: Built in the 13th century with intricate carvings and strong stone construction.

highlights.title: Major Pilgrimage Site
highlights.description: Visited by millions of devotees during festivals like Shravan and Maha Shivaratri.

geography.intro: Situated in Aundha town, Hingoli district, the temple stands amidst serene rural surroundings with historical and mythological significance.

climate.description: The climate in Aundha is generally dry with moderate winters and warm summers.

seasons.text: Winters (October–February): Pleasant and ideal for temple visits

geography.conclusion: Aundha Nagnath stands as a sacred testimony to Maharashtra’s deep-rooted Shaivite traditions and ancient heritage.

activities.title: Temple Darshan
activities.description: Seek blessings of Lord Nagnath during daily rituals and aarti ceremonies.
info: Morning and evening aartis attract large gatherings.
Special poojas can be arranged by devotees.

activities.title: Explore Temple Architecture
activities.description: Admire the stunning stone carvings, sculptures, and heritage design.
info: Walls depict stories from Shiva Purana.

activities.title: Attend Festivals
activities.description: Experience the energy and devotion during Maha Shivaratri and Shravan Utsav.

attractions.title: Sant Namdev Samadhi
attractions.description: A revered shrine dedicated to Sant Namdev, who is believed to have meditated here.

attractions.title: Nanded Gurudwara
attractions.description: A sacred Sikh pilgrimage site — Takht Sri Hazur Sahib — located in nearby Nanded.

marineLife.intro: Though Aundha is inland, its surroundings are home to diverse flora and fauna that add to its serene environment.

items.title: Flora
items.description: Rich greenery with banyan, peepal, and neem trees around the temple complex.

items.title: Fauna
items.description: Commonly spotted birds and animals include peacocks, sparrows, and squirrels.

conclusion: The natural beauty around the temple enhances the pilgrimage experience.
Peaceful surroundings provide an ideal environment for meditation and devotion.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Hingoli Deccan (22 km).
Regular trains from Mumbai, Aurangabad, and Nanded.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Well-connected via state highways to Parbhani, Nanded, and Hingoli.
Frequent MSRTC and private buses available.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Aurangabad Airport is about 200 km away.

bookingTips.description: Stay at local dharmashalas or nearby hotels in Hingoli or Nanded.
Visit early morning or during aarti for peaceful darshan.
Carry water and light snacks; the area can get hot during daytime.
